Plan Your Visit to Park City

Your Complete Guide to Planning the Perfect Mountain Adventure

Getting to Park City

Planning your Park City adventure? This comprehensive guide covers everything you need to know for an unforgettable visit. From transportation and accommodations to weather and packing tips, we've got you covered for every season.

By Air

Salt Lake City International Airport (SLC) - 35 minutes to Park City and the most convenient option for most visitors.

  • Transportation from Airport:
  • Rental car (recommended)
  • Shuttle services ($35-50)
  • Private car services
  • Uber/Lyft ($45-75)

By Car

From Salt Lake City: I-80 East to US-224 South (35 minutes)

From Denver: I-70 West to I-80 West (8 hours)

  • Parking in Park City:
  • Free parking on many streets
  • Paid lots downtown ($5-15/day)
  • Resort parking varies
  • China Bridge Park & Ride (free)

Getting Around Park City

Free Public Transit

Park City's award-winning free transit system connects all major destinations including ski resorts, Main Street, and shopping.

  • 100% free year-round
  • Routes to both ski resorts
  • Runs every 10-20 minutes
  • Bike racks available

Walking & Biking

Park City is very walkable, especially downtown. An extensive trail system connects many areas of town.

  • Main Street is pedestrian-friendly
  • Extensive bike trail network
  • Bike rentals available
  • E-bike options for hills

Ride Services

Uber and Lyft operate in Park City, along with local taxi services. Surge pricing common during peak times.

  • Uber & Lyft available
  • Local taxi companies
  • Surge pricing in peak season
  • Hotel shuttle services

When to Visit Park City

Winter (December - March)

Best For: Skiing, snowboarding, winter activities

Weather: Highs: 20-40°F, Lows: 5-20°F

  • Pros:
  • World-class skiing
  • Festive atmosphere
  • Sundance Film Festival
  • Cons:
  • Highest prices
  • Crowds
  • Cold weather

Summer (June - August)

Best For: Hiking, biking, festivals, outdoor activities

Weather: Highs: 75-85°F, Lows: 45-55°F

  • Pros:
  • Perfect hiking weather
  • Mountain activities
  • Festivals & events
  • Cons:
  • Higher summer prices
  • Afternoon thunderstorms
  • Limited activities compared to winter

Spring (April - May)

Best For: Budget travelers, fewer crowds

Weather: Highs: 50-70°F, Lows: 30-45°F

  • Pros:
  • Best hotel deals
  • Fewer crowds
  • Pleasant weather
  • Cons:
  • Ski season ending
  • Some attractions closed
  • Variable weather

Fall (September - November)

Best For: Fall foliage, hiking, good weather

Weather: Highs: 45-75°F, Lows: 25-45°F

  • Pros:
  • Beautiful fall colors
  • Comfortable temperatures
  • Good hiking weather
  • Cons:
  • Shorter days
  • Some activities seasonal
  • Weather can be unpredictable

What to Pack

Winter Essentials

  • Clothing:
  • Waterproof ski jacket & pants
  • Thermal base layers
  • Warm mid-layers (fleece/down)
  • Waterproof boots
  • Warm hat & gloves
  • Ski socks (wool or synthetic)
  • Gear:
  • Ski helmet (or rent)
  • Goggles
  • Sunglasses
  • Sunscreen (SPF 30+)
  • Lip balm with SPF

Summer Essentials

  • Clothing:
  • Layered clothing for temperature changes
  • Hiking boots or sturdy shoes
  • Light rain jacket
  • Shorts & t-shirts
  • Warm layer for evenings
  • Sun hat
  • Gear:
  • Sunscreen (SPF 30+)
  • Sunglasses
  • Water bottle
  • Daypack for hiking
  • Camera

Altitude & Health Considerations

Understanding Altitude

  • Park City base elevation: 7,000 feet
  • Ski resort peaks: 10,000+ feet
  • Lower oxygen levels than sea level
  • Effects felt by most visitors

Tips for Altitude Adjustment

  • Drink plenty of water
  • Avoid alcohol first few days
  • Take it easy initially
  • Eat light meals
  • Get plenty of rest

Budget Planning

Budget Range

  • Accommodation: $80-150/night
  • Food: $40-60/day
  • Activities: $30-50/day
  • Transportation: $20-40/day
  • Total: $170-300/day

Mid-Range

  • Accommodation: $150-400/night
  • Food: $60-100/day
  • Activities: $50-100/day
  • Transportation: $40-80/day
  • Total: $300-680/day

Luxury

  • Accommodation: $400-1,000+/night
  • Food: $100-200+/day
  • Activities: $100-300+/day
  • Transportation: $80-150/day
  • Total: $680-1,650+/day

Money-Saving Tips

Accommodation

  • Stay in shoulder seasons (spring/fall)
  • Book vacation rentals for longer stays
  • Consider staying in nearby towns
  • Look for package deals

Activities & Dining

  • Use free public transportation
  • Take advantage of free activities
  • Shop at grocery stores
  • Look for happy hour specials

Essential Information

Important Contacts

  • Emergency: 911
  • Park City Police: (435) 615-5500
  • Park City Medical Center: (435) 658-7000
  • Visitor Information: (435) 658-9616
  • Transit Info: (435) 615-5000

Local Services

  • Pharmacy: Walgreens, CVS available
  • Grocery: Fresh Market, Whole Foods
  • Bank/ATM: Multiple locations
  • Post Office: 1776 Park Ave
  • WiFi: Free at most hotels/cafes

Final Tips for Your Visit

Before You Go

  • Check weather forecasts
  • Book accommodations early
  • Purchase lift tickets online for discounts
  • Download the Park City app
  • Check resort websites for conditions

During Your Stay

  • Stay hydrated at altitude
  • Use free public transportation
  • Be flexible with outdoor plans
  • Try local restaurants
  • Take advantage of free activities
